titleStmt.title: Territory of Washington vs. George Woodard. Writ of Habeas Corpus

bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. George Woodard
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
be the matter of the application of George Woodard for a writ of Ha- beas corpus.
To the Honorable George Turner, Judge of the district court of the of fourth judicial court of Washington Territory: Your petitioner, George Woodard, respectfuly
That he is unlaw -fully detained, confined, and of his liberty by James Glispins Sheriff of Spokane County. as the city of Spokane falls in Spokane County. That the cause of unclear of constraint of your petitioner accor- ding to the best of the knowledge and be- lief of petitioner is that said Glispins holds your petitioner under and by of by one J.R Yildea,a Justice of the peace for the precint of Spangle, in the county of Spokane which said commitment is issued by said Justice of the Peace whom each a charge made before said Justice of the Peace against his petitioner for the crime of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor in the precint of Spangle in said Spokane County.
That said detention confinement,and impris- onment of petitioner is illegal and that the illegality-thereof consists in this in wit: That the affidavit and complaint under which the charge on which petitioner is unclear held was prosecuted, did not and does not charge this petitioner with the offense of un- lawfully selling intox- cating liquor, nor with any other offense whatever.
That the evidence offered against petitioner was wholly insufficient to show that there was or is probable cause for charging petitioner for the crime of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor or any other offense against the law what- ever.
That the pretended commitment under which petitioner is held by said James Glispins Sheriff is void,for that it appears whom the face thereof that said Justice of the peace and his power or authority of issue said commit- ment.
That said Justice of the peace required petitioner to give bail for his appearance before the district court to endeavour to said pretended charge of selling intoxicating liquor unlawfully in the time of That the said bail is excessive, because petitioner's unable to give bail, in said jail, and is able and willing if to give bail in the of two hundred and fifty dollars. that petitioner offered said justice of the peace good and sufficient bail in the of two hundred and fifty dollars. that said bail of five hun- dred dollars in excess- ive and appearing to this officer, be- cause it is out of proportion to the of- fense charged and is beyond the power of petitioner to give.
Therefore your petitioner that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted to the Jack James Glispins Sheriff of Spokane County commanding him to the body of said George Woodard before your honor at a time and place to be specified, to do and recieve what there there and there be con- fided by your Honor concerned crime, Together with the time and cause of detention of petitioner and said writ cued that he may be of his liberty. George Woodard
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
George Wood- ard, being sully sworn on any oath before and say; That the petitioner is the forg ing petition unclear That the con- tents of said petition and that the fact therein sealed are true. George Woodard
and sworn but before cue this 9th day of July on 1887. S.O Hyde Notary Public

James Glispins Sheriff
unclear and sworn before on the 9th day of July 1887. J.S am Notary Public

Whereis George Woodard has been brought this day before the of the of the peace is and for said court charge in the oath of B Richardson with on the 5th day of July 1887 in said county committed the offense of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor in the precint of Spangle in said county and in the of the of said charge of addressing to the said that the said George Woodard of the offense of unlawfully selling intoxicating liquor committed at the time and place afterward, and the said George Woodard law fully to give bail in the office woodard for his appearance at the next time of the court as represemted by in the name of the United States you commanded that with and to the said George Woodard with in said jail and his time until he be discharged by due process of law under my bound the 6th day of July 1887 J.R Yildea Justice of the Peace
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
In the matter of George Woodard
Territory of Washington vs. George Woodard
To James Glispins Sheriff of Spokane County In the cause of the United States to command you that you have the body of George Woodard, by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention by name said George Wood -ard and be called or charged before Honorable George Turner, Judge of the District Court of the Fourth Judicial District of the Territory of Washington as his as the city of Spokane Falls in Spokane County on the 9th day of July 1887 at the hour of ten o' clock a.m. to do and recieve what there and these be of him the said George Woodard and have you there and there this writ.
of Honorable George Turner, Judge of the said court and the thereof affirmed this 8th day of July 1887 D.A Clement Clerk
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
Thereof certify that by writ of the written writ has the body of the Woodard now in court in as directed by the written writ date July 9th 1887 Glispins Sheriff of Spokane County
(upside down)
He Re George Woodard writ of Habeas Corpus
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
Territory of Washington Plaintiff In the District Court of vs. the Territory of Washington F.E Pierce in and for the Fourth Defendant Judicial Districtthereof, holding terms at Spokane Falls, Spokane County in said Territory.
To the Sheriff of Spokane County, Greeting, In the name of the United States, You are hereby commanded to summon J.R. Yildea and bring with him the affidavit complaint and of Testimony taken in about case and all papers in said cause.
to be and appear before the District Court, at the Court House in Spokane Falls, in said county, on the 9th day of July A.D. 1887 at ten o' clock a.m. to here give evidence in the above entitled cause on part of said defendant there to remain until discharged. WITNESS the Hon. George Turner, Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of Washington Terrtory and Justice of said Court,and the Seal thereof affixed this 8th day of July A.D. 1887 D.A Clement clerk By deputy
Territory of Washington County of Spokane
I here certify that I served the within Subpoena on the within named witness by reading the same to him in said County, on this ninth day of July A.D 1887 James Glispins Sheriff By Deputy
Subpoena In the District Court of the Territory of Wash- ington , and for the Fourth Judicial District thereof holding terms of Spokane Falls, Spokane County, in said Territory.

to be and appear before the District Court, at the Court House in Spokane Falls, in said county, on the 9th day of July A.D. 1887 at ten o' clock a.m. to here give evidence in the above entitled cause on part of said defendant there to remain until discharged.
